snippet: Companies are selling bonds at low interest rates and people with strong credit have “ready access” to credit card and auto loans, Ben S. Bernanke, said.
abstract: Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S Bernanke, says that many businesses and consumers are finding it easier to borrow as banks shore up their balance sheets; says that credit conditions in the United States have improved in a number of areas.
lead_paragraph: Companies are selling bonds at low interest rates and people with strong credit have “ready access” to credit card and auto loans, Ben S. Bernanke, said.

headline.seo: Credit Conditions Improving In U.S., Fed Chairman Says
